channel.title: #sketch on Micro blog
channel.description: Recent content in #sketch on Micro blog

item.title: Visualization for dummies ... from dummies
item.description: Visualization for dummies … from dummies # This is my talk from 2022 about visualisations pdf Notebook

item.title: Which professions in the UK are most likely to feel pressure to drink with workmates?
item.description: A few words about viz tools and Which professions in the UK are most likely to feel pressure to drink with workmates? I hate f*king ~fairyland~ bi tools (true) The more I use visualisation tools, the less convenient they seem to me.

item.title: I would say a few words about communication courses
item.description: I would say a few words about communication courses # Techniques to improve the quality and speed of communication. Following anti-fragility principles and being prepared for black swans. How to give and receive high-quality feedback.

item.title: Demoscene as UNESCO cultural heritage and unperformable music
item.description: Demoscene accepted as UNESCO cultural heritage in The Netherlands and topic about unperformable music # The Dutch inscription is continuing the success story of the demoscene as first digital culture accepted by the UNESCO.

item.title: Experiments in music
item.description: Experiments in music # Music, in all its forms, is all around us. I was interested in combining something completely incongruous. And one of the experiments is Chopin + meow noise

item.title: CultureWorldMap
item.description: I hate f*king ~fairyland~ bi tools (lie) # My Tableau CultureWorldMap How do Europeans call something that is too far away # Some maps by Yanko Tsvetkov # Yanko Tsvetkov atlasofprejudice.

item.title: Random sketch comics
item.description: Degradation of drawing # How I used to draw comics 8-12 years ago # How I used to draw comics 4-5 years ago # PDF file How I used to draw comics 2-3 years ago # Now # The main aim was to create a short, monochromatic fragment-strip story, without text that could be read in any order, and imagine a story based on the reader’s mind/personal interpretation.
